result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Tonya R. Koos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Pay DNA surcharge  $200.
Review Hearing on 7/24/15 @ 8:30am.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tonya R. Koos

records.addlTxt: Count 1.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft completed the terms of the HOA.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  By mutual agreement of parties the court extends the hold open agreement to 7/1/16.  RH continued to 6/30/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
to revoke hold open agreement; filed by ADA Carli McNeill.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states will be contesting the State's request to revoke the HOA.  MH set for 12/2/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states she would like time to look for information on an alleged retail theft in Mt Pleasant.  RH continued to 10/28/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson requests to set over til the P&P Agt is back from leave.  RH continued to 9/11/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
Terminated regular on 6/25/15
atty K Watson

the Kohl's Corp to produce Atty King the documents that he requested in his subpoenas duces tecum dated 4/17/14 which were personally served on the registered agent of the Kohl's Corp on 4/21/14.

Atty King acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  DA PTC 5/16/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 6/2/14 at 8:45am; return on subpoena date set for 4/28/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Everett King. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by ADA McNeill.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 3-31-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
